item.title: Sequence
item.description: from The Computing Zone Check here to see how to hand-in these checkpoint tasks. 1. Three in, three out Write a program that will allow a user to enter their name (string), their age (integer) and their favourite TV program (string). The program will then display the information entered and some additional text on separate lines. An example of the input and output from the program is shown below.

item.title: Selection
item.description: from The Computing Zone Check here to see how to hand-in these checkpoint tasks. 9. Advice please Write a program that asks the user if they would like some advice. If they enter Y, provide them with an amusing message. Would you like some advice? > Y Always know where your towel is. Would you like some advice? > N 10. Darts During a game of darts, the highest score that can be achieved in a single turn is 180.

item.title: Iteration
item.description: from The Computing Zone Check here to see how to hand-in these checkpoint tasks. 13. Lines cheat A naughty pupil has been given lines to copy as a punishment from their Computing teacher. The have been asked to type out “I must not behave like muppet in class” 20 times. Write a program that asks a pupil to enter a sentence. The same sentence should then be displayed 20 times.
